amendment.description: An amendment numbered 260 printed in Part D of House Report 117-241 to amend Title III by broadening Pell Grant eligibility to high-quality short term skills and job training programs and to establish a secure and privacy-protected data system that contains information about postsecondary student academic and economic outcomes.
amendment.purpose: Amendment amends Title III by broadening Pell Grant eligibility to high-quality short term skills and job training programs and to establish a secure and privacy-protected data system that contains information about postsecondary student academic and economic outcomes.

vote.text: On agreeing to the Levin (MI) amendment (A013) Agreed to by the Yeas and Nays: 238 - 193 (Roll no. 29).

action.text: The previous question was ordered on the amendment (A013) pursuant to the rule.
House amendment offered/reported by: Amendment (A013) offered by Mr. Levin (MI).
House amendment agreed to: On agreeing to the Levin (MI) amendment (A013) Agreed to by the Yeas and Nays: 238 - 193 (Roll no. 29).
Amendment agreed to by House: On agreeing to the Levin (MI) amendment (A013) Agreed to by the Yeas and Nays: 238 - 193 (Roll no. 29).
